citation.article-title: Tateyamaria omphalii gen. nov., sp. nov., an alpha-Proteobacterium isolated from a top shell Omphalius pfeifferi pfeifferi.

p.s: Description of Tateyamaria omphalii sp. nov.
T. omphalii (om.phal’i.i. N.L. gen. n. omphalii, of Omphalius, the genus of the top shell, from which the strain was isolated).
The description of this species is the same as that of the genus described above.
The colonies on marine agar are 4–5 mm in diameter after 2–3 d incubation at 25 °C.
No growth occurs at temperatures above 37 °C or below 4 °C.
Both catalase and oxidase are positive.
Hydrolysis of esculin is observed, while that of gelatin and urea is not.
ß-Galactosidase and acetoin are produced, while H2S and indole are not.

It produces acids from glucose, but it does not produce acids from the following compounds: glycerol, d-, l-arabinose, ribose, galactose, rhamnose, inositol, mannitol, sorbitol, maltose, lactose, melibiose, saccharose, and gluconate.
The type strain is MKT107T (=IAM 15108T=KCTC 12333T), which was isolated from the gastrointestinal tract of the molluscan top shell O. pfeifferi pfeifferi at Chiba, Japan.
